intro: Rhynchosia teramnoides, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is a climbing vine characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces small, leguminous pods that contain several seeds. It is native to Africa and thrives in warm, tropical climates. Rhynchosia teramnoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some cultures.
